00019 #ifndef TLM_UTILS_MULTI_PASSTHROUGH_INITIATOR_SOCKET_H_INCLUDED_
00020 #define TLM_UTILS_MULTI_PASSTHROUGH_INITIATOR_SOCKET_H_INCLUDED_
00021 
00022 #include "multi_socket_bases.h"
00023 
00024 namespace tlm_utils {
00025 
00026 /*
00027 This class implements a trivial multi initiator socket.
00028 The triviality refers to the fact that the socket does not
00029 do blocking to non-blocking or non-blocking to blocking conversions.
00030 
00031 It allows to connect multiple targets to this socket.
00032 The user has to register callbacks for the bw interface methods
00033 he likes to use. The callbacks are basically equal to the bw interface
00034 methods but carry an additional integer that indicates to which
00035 index of this socket the calling target is connected.
00036 */
00037 template <typename MODULE,
00038           unsigned int BUSWIDTH = 32,
00039           typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types,
00040           unsigned int N=0, sc_core::sc_port_policy POL = sc_core::SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00041 class multi_passthrough_initiator_socket
00042   : public multi_init_base< BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL>
00043 {
00044 public:
00045 
00046   //typedefs
00047   //  tlm 2.0 types for nb_transport
00048   typedef typename TYPES::tlm_payload_type              transaction_type;
00049   typedef typename TYPES::tlm_phase_type                phase_type;
00050   typedef tlm::tlm_sync_enum                            sync_enum_type;
00051 
00052   //  typedefs to keep the fn ptr notations short
00053   typedef sync_enum_type (MODULE::*nb_cb)(int,
00054                                          transaction_type&,
00055                                          phase_type&,
00056                                          sc_core::sc_time&);
00057   typedef void (MODULE::*dmi_cb)(int, sc_dt::uint64, sc_dt::uint64);
00058 
00059   typedef multi_init_base<BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL> base_type;
00060 
00061   typedef typename base_type::base_target_socket_type base_target_socket_type;
00062 
00063   static const char* default_name()
00064     { return sc_core::sc_gen_unique_name("multi_passthrough_initiator_socket"); }
00065 
00066   //CTOR
00067   explicit multi_passthrough_initiator_socket(const char* name = default_name())
00068       : base_type(name)
00069       , m_hierarch_bind(0)
00070       , m_beoe_disabled(false)
00071       , m_dummy(this,42)
00072   {
00073   }
00074 
00075   ~multi_passthrough_initiator_socket(){
00076     //clean up everything allocated by 'new'
00077     for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_binders.size(); i++) delete m_binders[i];
00078   }
00079 
00080   //register callback for nb transport of bw interface
00081   void register_nb_transport_bw(MODULE* mod,
00082                               sync_enum_type (MODULE::*cb)(int,
00083                                                            transaction_type&,
00084                                                            phase_type&,
00085                                                            sc_core::sc_time&))
00086   {
00087     //warn if there already is a callback
00088     if (m_nb_f.is_valid()){
00089       display_warning("NBTransport_bw callback already registered.");
00090       return;
00091     }
00092 
00093     //set the functor
00094     m_nb_f.set_function(mod, cb);
00095   }
00096 
00097   //register callback for dmi function of bw interface
00098   void register_invalidate_direct_mem_ptr(MODULE* mod,
00099                              void (MODULE::*cb)(int, sc_dt::uint64, sc_dt::uint64))
00100   {
00101     //warn if there already is a callback
00102     if (m_dmi_f.is_valid()){
00103       display_warning("InvalidateDMI callback already registered.");
00104       return;
00105     }
00106 
00107     //set the functor
00108     m_dmi_f.set_function(mod, cb);
00109   }
00110 
00111   //Override virtual functions of the tlm_initiator_socket:
00112   // this function is called whenever an sc_port (as part of a target socket)
00113   //  wants to bind to the export of the underlying tlm_initiator_socket
00114   //At this time a callback binder is created an returned to the sc_port
00115   // of the target socket, so that it binds to the callback binder
00116   virtual tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>& get_base_interface()
00117   {
00118     m_binders.push_back(new callback_binder_bw<TYPES>(this, m_binders.size()));
00119     return *m_binders[m_binders.size()-1];
00120   }
00121 
00122   // const overload not allowed for multi-sockets
00123   virtual const tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>& get_base_interface() const
00124   {
00125     display_error("'get_base_interface()' const not allowed for multi-sockets.");
00126     return base_type::get_base_interface();
00127   }
00128 
00129   //Override virtual functions of the tlm_initiator_socket:
00130   // this function is called whenever an sc_export (as part of a initiator socket)
00131   //  wants to bind to the export of the underlying tlm_initiator_socket
00132   //   i.e. a hierarchical bind takes place
00133   virtual sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES> >& get_base_export()
00134   {
00135     if (!m_beoe_disabled) //we are not bound hierarchically
00136       base_type::m_export.bind(m_dummy);  //so we bind the dummy to avoid a SystemC error
00137     return base_type::get_base_export(); //and then return our own export so that the hierarchical binding is set up properly
00138   }
00139 
00140   virtual const sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES> >& get_base_export() const
00141   {
00142     return base_type::get_base_export();
00143   }
00144 
00145   //bind against a target socket
00146   virtual void bind(base_target_socket_type& s)
00147   {
00148     //error if this socket is already bound hierarchically
00149     if (m_hierarch_bind) {
00150       display_error("Already hierarchically bound.");
00151       return;
00152     }
00153 
00154     base_type::bind(s); //satisfy systemC, leads to a call to get_base_interface()
00155 
00156     //try to cast the target socket into a fw interface
00157     sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES> >* p_ex_s=dynamic_cast<sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES> >*>(&s);
00158     if (!p_ex_s) {
00159       display_error("Multi socket not bound to tlm_socket.");
00160       return;
00161     }
00162 
00163     //try a cast into a multi sockets
00164     multi_to_multi_bind_base<TYPES>* test=dynamic_cast<multi_to_multi_bind_base<TYPES>*> (p_ex_s);
00165     if (test) //did we just do a multi-multi bind??
00166       //if that is the case the multi target socket must have just created a callback binder
00167       // which we want to get from it.
00168       //Moreover, we also just created one, which we will pass to it.
00169       m_sockets.push_back(test->get_last_binder(m_binders[m_binders.size()-1]));
00170     else{  // if not just bind normally
00171       sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES> >& ex_s=*p_ex_s;
00172       m_sockets.push_back(&((tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>&)ex_s)); //store the interface we are bound against
00173     }
00174   }
00175 
00176   //operator notation for direct bind
00177   void operator() (base_target_socket_type& s)
00178   {
00179     bind(s);
00180   }
00181 
00182   //SystemC standard callback before end of elaboration
00183   void before_end_of_elaboration(){
00184     //if our export hasn't been bound yet (due to a hierarch binding)
00185     // we bind it now to avoid a SystemC error.
00186     //We must do that, because it is legal not to register a callback on this socket
00187     // as the user might only use b_transport
00188     if (!base_type::m_export.get_interface()){
00189       base_type::m_export.bind(m_dummy);
00190     }
00191 
00192     //'break' here if the socket was told not to do callback binding
00193     if (m_beoe_disabled) return;
00194 
00195     //get the callback binders of the top of the hierachical bind chain
00196     // NOTE: this could be the same socket if there is no hierachical bind
00197     std::vector<callback_binder_bw<TYPES>* >& binders=get_hierarch_bind()->get_binders();
00198 
00199     //get the interfaces bound to the top of the hierachical bind chain
00200     // NOTE: this could be the same socket if there is no hierachical bind
00201     m_used_sockets=get_hierarch_bind()->get_sockets();
00202 
00203     //register the callbacks of this socket with the callback binders
00204     // we just got from the top of the hierachical bind chain
00205     for (unsigned int i=0; i<binders.size(); i++) {
00206       binders[i]->set_callbacks(m_nb_f, m_dmi_f);
00207     }
00208   }
00209 
00210   //
00211   // Bind multi initiator socket to multi initiator socket (hierarchical bind)
00212   //
00213   virtual void bind(base_type& s)
00214   {
00215     if (m_binders.size()) {
00216       //a multi socket is either bound hierarchically or directly
00217       display_error("Socket already directly bound.");
00218       return;
00219     }
00220     if (m_hierarch_bind){
00221       display_warning("Socket already bound hierarchically. Bind attempt ignored.");
00222       return;
00223     }
00224 
00225     //remember to which socket we are hierarchically bound and disable it,
00226     // so that it won't try to register callbacks itself
00227     s.disable_cb_bind();
00228     m_hierarch_bind=&s;
00229     base_type::bind(s); //satisfy SystemC
00230   }
00231 
00232   //operator notation for hierarchical bind
00233   void operator() (base_type& s)
00234   {
00235     bind(s);
00236   }
00237 
00238   //get access to sub port
00239   tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>* operator[](int i){return m_used_sockets[i];}
00240 
00241   //get the number of bound targets
00242   // NOTE: this is only valid at end of elaboration!
00243   unsigned int size() {return get_hierarch_bind()->get_sockets().size();}
00244 
00245 protected:
00246   using base_type::display_warning;
00247   using base_type::display_error;
00248 
00249   //implementation of base class interface
00250   base_type* get_hierarch_bind(){if (m_hierarch_bind) return m_hierarch_bind->get_hierarch_bind(); else return this;}
00251   void disable_cb_bind(){ m_beoe_disabled=true;}
00252   std::vector<callback_binder_bw<TYPES>* >& get_binders(){return m_binders;}
00253   std::vector<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>*>& get_sockets(){return m_sockets;}
00254   //vector of connected sockets
00255   std::vector<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>*> m_sockets;
00256   std::vector<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>*> m_used_sockets;
00257   //vector of binders that convert untagged interface into tagged interface
00258   std::vector<callback_binder_bw<TYPES>*> m_binders;
00259 
00260   base_type*  m_hierarch_bind; //pointer to hierarchical bound multi port
00261   bool m_beoe_disabled;  // bool that remembers whether this socket shall bind callbacks or not
00262   callback_binder_bw<TYPES> m_dummy; //a callback binder that is bound to the underlying export
00263                                      // in case there was no real bind
00264 
00265   //callbacks as functors
00266   // (allows to pass the callback to another socket that does not know the type of the module that owns
00267   //  the callbacks)
00268   typename callback_binder_bw<TYPES>::nb_func_type  m_nb_f;
00269   typename callback_binder_bw<TYPES>::dmi_func_type m_dmi_f;
00270 };
00271 
00272 template <typename MODULE,
00273           unsigned int BUSWIDTH = 32,
00274           typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types,
00275           unsigned int N=0>
00276 class multi_passthrough_initiator_socket_optional
00277   : public multi_passthrough_initiator_socket<MODULE,BUSWIDTH,TYPES,N,sc_core::SC_ZERO_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00278 {
00279   typedef multi_passthrough_initiator_socket<MODULE,BUSWIDTH,TYPES,N,sc_core::SC_ZERO_OR_MORE_BOUND> socket_b;
00280 public:
00281   multi_passthrough_initiator_socket_optional() : socket_b() {}
00282   explicit multi_passthrough_initiator_socket_optional(const char* name) : socket_b(name) {}
00283 };
00284 
00285 } // namespace tlm_utils
00286 #endif // TLM_UTILS_MULTI_PASSTHROUGH_INITIATOR_SOCKET_H_INCLUDED_
